content.description:
Right most line. Climb thin steep face to slab. The intent is to stay over or just left of the bolt line. To the right is Choss! Too far left and it eases off.

 Continue up easy slab to crack and corner to top.
content.protection: many bolts and bolted anchor over top of cliff.

content.description: Start under a large "V". Climb easy ground to first high bolt (5.3). Move up to second bolt by back stepping wall behind you. Next lie back the arête to the top. Pulling over/around the arête before the anchor makes it loads easier (not recommended), not sure if you can clip when doing so.
Start on Misnomer and at the second bolt remain in the lower angle dihedral instead of going right to the arete. At the end of the corner move to the anchors on Misnomer.
Easily climb to the first high bolt. Then make thin moves straight up to bolts 2 and 3.
Climb crack left of itza face. It's a contrived crack climb, but its a crack climb!
content.protection: TR after sending Itza Face  or a very bold trad lead
content.location: Left of Itza Face. Climb trivially to high crack. Follow crack to Itza Face anchors

content.description: Stat left of junk dirt slope. Climb mantles to first high bolt. Then easy second clip. Next move up face to third bolt (a bit thin) and then 4th bolt. At 4th bolt make tricky 2 move traverse RIGHTto a small pinchy corner and then up to anchors.The "crack" to the left is not necessary for the send!
content.protection: 4 bolts to 2 bolt anchor with rings

content.description: Climb the dihedral left of Itza slab. passing 3 or 4 bolts to a roof. Move right under roof to the shared anchors of Itza Slab

climbs.name: Granola in the Grigri
climbs.fa: Ian Fenimore, Mary Porter, and Tony Azzi

content.description: Stick clip highly recommended. A steep sequential boulder problem gains you access to a slabby face and a good stance at the first bolt. Follow ample holds and steepening terrain through 3 more bolts before engaging in a physical crack crux at the fifth and final bolt. Clipping the anchors is made a bit easier due to addition of chain at anchors, but may still be difficult for short climbers. Unfortunately the top of the crack is eternally doomed to be a bit muddy and damp as it is the runoff point for the ledge above.Stays shaded until about 1pm.
content.location: Left side of Zero Wing Buttress

content.description: Climb slightly over hanging rock past 3 bolts to a delicate slab and 2 more bolts to a 2 bolt anchor

If you've ever had a man on a bike with a fanny pack stop you near cemetery wall to talk to you about birds and show you pictures of them, then you've met Brad. He is a local and likes to help with the Fish and Game commission to help monitor the birds. Take a minute and talk to him if you see him stopped at a bench, he's a good guy.Stick clip highly reccomended. Start on crystalline rock about 5 feet right of "granola in the gri gri". Go straight up into the alcove, using thoughtful beta to climb right of the hollow block on the left (crowbar couldn't move it, but I wouldn't go yanking on it). Move up and right out the alcove utilizing very thin holds and thumb presses. Find a way to make your feet stick to pop up to actual holds and follow to the anchor. Stays shaded until about 1pm.
content.location: Left end of zero wing Buttress.

content.description: Starting from the dirt ledge right 15' right of Zero Wing. Climb up face and bulge then move a little right and climb to Zero Wing Anchor.
Start left of Zero Wing.   Balancy and delicate liebacking on small corner.   Climb up to high bolt. Follow corner to stance.   Then a few easy moves to Anchors
Climb the center of smooth slab right of Blue Moon.
content.location:
50' left of Zero Wing wall. look up to see a large pyramid rock about 70' up the dirt slope. 

 30' up hill from obfuscation corner

content.description: Climb right facing corner left of Mani and the wolves. Follow steep crack at top to anchors for Dark Side of the moon
content.location:
50' left of Zero Wing wall. look up to see a large pyramid rock about 70' up the dirt slope. 

 Left of Mani

content.description: Climb overhanging Wall on the southern face of the formation
content.location:
50' left of Zero Wing wall. look up to see a large pyramid rock about 70' up the dirt slope. 

 Left most route on the southern face 30' up hill from the start of Obfuscation Corner

content.description: Climb the right corner of the face staying mostly on the front side placing gear when able. At 30 feet move left into a "crack" and move up and right to its own bolted anchor.
content.location:
50' left of Zero Wing wall. look up to see a large pyramid rock about 70' up the dirt slope. 

 The right (south) corner of the face.

content.description:
Start under a bolt and climb straight up following bolts and placing gear when able to a bolted anchor.

 Variation 1: Instead of using the first bolt, move up and right following pockets until you are about half way between the Bark at the Moon's start and the Obfuscation corner. From there climb up and then left meeting Bark at the Moon at the third bolt.
content.protection: 5 Bolts, Smaller Aliens, Slings, Nuts, Cams to 3"
content.location:
50' left of Zero Wing wall. look up to see a large pyramid rock about 70' up the dirt slope. 

 The more right of the  two bolt/mixed lines on the face

content.description: Start at small tree under the left most line of bolts. Although there are a few bolts on this route one might want a few trad pieces in between. Climb mostly straight up following bolts and placing gear when able to a right arching finger crack that leads to a bolted anchor
content.location:
50' left of Zero Wing wall. look up to see a large pyramid rock about 70' up the dirt slope. 

 The more left of the two bolted/mixed lines.

content.description: Climb a mostly straight line up the left side of the face to a maple? tree sling anchor. Top out or rap. Optionally one could follow a right arching finger crack to a bolted anchor.
content.location:
50' left of Zero Wing wall. look up to see a large pyramid rock about 70' up the dirt slope.

 Start just right of the far left side of the face.

content.description: taller crag with 2 lines
